channel.title: April 2013 top stories from USA Today, brought to you by GEICO
channel.description: April 2013 Top News from USA Today

item.title: Student wrongly tied to Boston bombings found dead
item.description: A body pulled from the water in a Rhode Island park has been identified as a Brown University student who was mistakenly linked by amateur sleuths on a social media site to the Boston bombings.

item.title: Man tries to take photo of beaver; it kills him
item.description: Forget sharks: It's beavers that are truly terrifying. A fisherman in Belarus was bitten to death by one, and all he was doing was trying to take its picture, Sky News reports. The man spotted the beaver while

item.title: At least 3 dead, 141 injured in Boston Marathon blasts
item.description: At least three people died and more than 140 others were injured Monday after two blasts ripped through the crowd near the finish line of the Boston Marathon.

item.title: As manhunt ends, new questions emerge in Boston bombings
item.description: The Chechen brothers at the heart of the Boston Marathon bombing investigation lived regular American lives - until something changed them.

item.title: Philadelphia abortion clinic horror: Column
item.description: We've forgotten what belongs on Page One.

item.title: Details emerge on Boston suspect Dzhokhar Tsarnaev
item.description: The surviving Boston bomb suspect has been identified as Dzhokhar A. Tsarnaev, 19, of Cambridge, Mass, according to the Associated Press.

item.title: Investigators claim major progress in Boston bombings
item.description: Investigators combing through photos and videotape believe they have identified images of a suspect seen delivering one of the explosive devices that killed three people at the Boston Marathon.

item.title: Boston bombs were pressure cookers filled with metal
item.description: The explosive devices that killed three people and injured scores at the Boston Marathon finish line were pressure cookers filled with metal and ball bearings, according to a federal law enforcement official..

item.title: 2013 NFL draft: First round pick-by-pick analysis
item.description: Check out every pick from the NFL draft's first round.

item.title: MIT shooting triggers massive police operation in Boston
item.description: A Cambridge, Mass., police officer said that an MIT police officer was shot Wednesday night. MIT campus police referred a caller to the campus news bureau, where no one answered calls.

item.title: Marathon victim in iconic photo has both legs amputated
item.description: The father of a man injured in the Boston Marathon bombing says his son had both legs amputated. Jeff Bauman says his son, 27-year-old Jeff Bauman Jr., is the man pictured in an Associated Press photo.

item.title: Search continues in rubble of Texas fertilizer blast
item.description: Explosions rocked a fertilizer facility in West, Texas, on Wednesday evening as firefighters were battling an onsite blaze.

item.title: Uncle: Tamerlan Tsarnaev called, asked for forgiveness
item.description: Police have identified Tamerlan Tsarnaev, 26, as the dead bombing suspect. He was killed in a dramatic firefight with police in nearby Watertown.

item.title: FBI releases images of two suspects near Boston bomb sites
item.description: Investigators are exploring a number of promising leads in the Boston Marathon bombing case, including an image of a man believed possibly involved in one of Monday's twin explosions that killed three people.

item.title: First Take: Vitriol infests Warren family grief
item.description: In the social media tide of response to the suicide of Pastor Rick Warren's son, Matthew, there are flames of condemnation for Warren and his Christian message.

item.title: Mississippi man arrested in ricin letters case
item.description: The FBI said Wednesday it has arrested a Mississippi man

item.title: Arrest of 3 teens in assault, suicide opens raw wounds
item.description: The arrest of the 16-year olds on sexual battery charges on an intoxicated, unconscious teen have reopened raw wounds for the family of a 15-year-old who hanged over the incident in September.

item.title: Boston bombing suspect opening up to police
item.description: The surviving suspect in last week's Boston Marathon bombings began responding to investigators' questions Sunday evening.

item.title: Official: Boston suspect awake, responding in writing
item.description: Investigators are still waiting to interrogate Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, the surviving suspect in last week's Boston Marathon bombing.

item.title: Gwyneth Paltrow goes from 'beautiful' to 'humiliated'
item.description: Gwyneth Paltrow admits her sheer-sided 'Iron Man 3' premiere dress caused her to go from

item.title: Texas student accused in stabbing spree at college
item.description: At least 14 students were injured -- two critically -- in a stabbing spree on the campus of Lone Star College-CyFair near Houston.

item.title: Jennifer Love Hewitt apologizes for 'wowser' dress
item.description: Jennifer Love Hewitt wows with her dress today on The Ellen DeGeneres Show.

item.title: Guinness record holder dies tragically while repeating stunt
item.description: An Indian daredevil who made it into the Guinness Book of World Records died yesterday while repeating a version of his stunt, reports the BBC. Sailendra Nath Roy entered the record books in 2011 after

item.title: Pastor Rick Warren blames son's death on depression
item.description: Rick Warren, one of the best known evangelical pastors worldwide, announced Saturday his son had killed himself Friday night.

item.title: Gunman identified in Georgia SWAT shootout
item.description: A quiet subdivision in this suburb north of Atlanta was recovering Thursday from a violent confrontation that ended when police stormed a home Wednesday evening, killing a gunman who had held four firefighters hostage.

item.title: Background check compromise losing support
item.description: The Senate rejected a bipartisan deal to expand gun background checks, as it began voting on a host of amendments to a measure aimed at curbing gun violence.

item.title: George Jones, country superstar, dies
item.description: The peerless, hard-living country singer who recorded dozens of hits was 81.

item.title: Kendra Wilkinson quits 'Splash'
item.description: She walked all the way up. She looked cute in her suit. But when it came time to dive, Kendra Wilkinson couldn't do it. On Tuesday's Splash, the reality show star quit.

item.title: Kmart's 'ship my pants' ad causes shockwaves and smiles
item.description: Sophomoric? Silly? Or a smart strategic move? The jury is out on a new Kmart ad that uses slight of mouth --

item.title: Jets waive Tim Tebow after one season
item.description: Tebow lasted just one season with the Jets after two years with the Broncos.

item.title: Lindsey Vonn's ex-husband jokes about Tiger Woods
item.description: Who called in Tiger's two-stroke penalty on Friday?

item.title: 'Gate to Hell' discovered in Turkey
item.description: As far as archaeological discoveries go, it's a darker one: Pluto's Gate -- aka, the fabled gate to the underworld -- has reportedly been unearthed in Turkey.

item.title: Trisha Yearwood wows with weight loss
item.description: Trisha Yearwood wows with weight loss at the ACM show.

item.title: Maine hermit living in wild for 27 years arrested
item.description: A man who lived like a hermit for decades in a makeshift camp in the woods and may be responsible for more than 1,000 burglaries for food and other staples.

item.title: Illinois mayor's nephew kills 5, dies after firefight
item.description: Five people -- including two children -- were killed in an overnight shooting in Manchester, Ill. Police later killed the gunman.

item.title: Officer killed in MIT standoff ID'd as Sean Collier, 26
item.description: MIT police officer Sean Collier, 26, of Somerville, Mass., died last night after two men fired gun shots at Collier, who responded to a disturbance on the campus.

item.title: Warrant: Wife of ex-judge confesses in Texas DA killings
item.description: The wife of a former Texas justice of the peace has been arrested on capital murder charges in the killings of of the Kaufman County district attorney, his wife and a second prosecutor, The Dallas Morning News reports.

item.title: Pressure-cooker bomb instructions in al-Qaeda magazine
item.description: Instructions to make bombs out of pressure cookers similar to those believed the source of two fatal explosions in Boston Monday were published two years ago in Inspire, an online magazine tied to al-Qaeda.

item.title: Affidavits: Suspect in ricin case 'delusional'
item.description: Suspect in ricin case allegedly believes he was the target of a wide-ranging government conspiracy after stumbling onto a plot to sell body parts.

item.title: 2013 NFL draft: Team-by-team selections
item.description: See the picks for every team in the 2013 NFL draft.

item.title: 'Teen Mom' star now an adult film actress
item.description: Farrah Abraham admits to starring in a porn clip, which she's shopping around.

item.title: Thousands post to Dzhokhar Tsarnaev on social media
item.description: The manhunt for Boston Marathon bombing suspect DzhokharTsarnaev ended Friday night, after thousands of posts on his VKontakte page during the search.

item.title: 3rd Boston fatality is Lu Lingzi of China
item.description: The third person killed in the Boston Marathon bombings was a Chinese graduate student at Boston University named Lu Lingzi, a state-run Chinese newspaper reported Wednesday.

item.title: Omarosa fired from 'Celebrity Apprentice'
item.description: Celebrity Apprentice has lost a big villain. Donald Trump fired Omarosa on Sunday's episode.

item.title: Kids killed as mom tries to go through train crossing
item.description: BATAVIA, Iowa -- The sound of passing freight trains is a constant backdrop in this small southeast Iowa community. So is the sight of people driving around lowered gates at the Fourth Street crossing.

item.title: Save Our Shows 2013
item.description: Vote on which scripted sitcoms and dramas deserve new seasons or to be discarded.

item.title: Tiger Woods gets 2-shot penalty, not disqualification
item.description: Tiger Woods is still in the Masters but has been assessed a two-shot penalty.

item.title: Yvette Prieto is Michael Jordan's fiancee: Who is she?
item.description: 1. Is a Cuban-American model. Prieto was born in Cuba. Most press accounts call her a model, but it's hard to find pictures of her modeling anywhere else than on MJ's arm. She's done it for some designers, but

item.title: 2 shot at Denver marijuana rally
item.description: DENVER (AP) — Denver police say one person has been shot in the leg and another is down with unknown injuries after shots were fired at a marijuana celebration held to mark the counterculture holiday 4/20.

item.title: Roundup: The latest on the Boston Marathon explosions
item.description: A moment of silence is observed before Monday night's game between the Denver Nuggets and Milwaukee Bucks at the Bradley Center. (Photo: Jeff Hanisch, USA TODAY Sports) The morning after two explosions rocked

item.title: Ex-porn star Jenna Jameson arrested for battery
item.description: Ex-porn star Jenna Jameson was arrested for battery on Saturday night.

item.title: Five living presidents toast new Bush library
item.description: George W. Bush Presidential Center will be dedicated in Dallas on Thursday.

item.title: Comedian Jonathan Winters dies at age 87
item.description: Comedian Jonathan Winters died Thursday in California at 87.

item.title: 2013 NFL draft grades: An 'A' for effort goes to ...
item.description: It takes about three seasons to accurately evaluate an NFL draft. It doesn't take 24 hours to unfairly grade it. So based on first impressions, USA TODAY Sports hands out report cards (written in pencil) for

item.title: Adam Lanza's mom was alarmed by his gruesome images
item.description: Nancy Lanza, the mother of Newtown gunman Adam Lanza, had grown increasingly concerned about her son's state of mind but did not confront him after finding ghastly drawings of dead bodies in his room.

item.title: Witherspoon 'deeply embarrassed' about arrest
item.description: The actress is accused of disobeying an officer's instructions.

item.title: Older Tsarnaev brother: 'I don't understand' Americans
item.description: Mystery shrouds trail of two brothers in Boston Marathon bombings.

item.title: Brad Johnson paying physical price for long NFL career
item.description: After playing 17 seasons in the NFL, hardest task for Brad Johnson is getting out of bed

item.title: Michael Jordan wedding draws famous guests
item.description: Michael Jordan got married over the weekend in front of a few hundred of his family and closest friends. The Charlotte Bobcats owner exchanged vows with 35-year-old former model Yvette Prieto on Saturday.

item.title: Disney Fan Club: Annette Funicello has died
item.description: Annette Funicello has died, according to Disney's official fan club Twitter.

item.title: N. Korea approves 'merciless' attack on U.S.
item.description: North Korea stopped South Korean workers from entering a joint industrial complex in the North Wednesday, in the latest escalation of the weeks-long crisis on the long-troubled Korean Peninsula.

item.title: Woman's DNA found on Boston bomb
item.description: Female DNA has been found on at least one of the Boston Marathon bombs, but investigators have not determined whose it is or whether it indicates a woman helped execute the April 15 bombings.

item.title: Ex-Patriots lineman carried woman to safety after Boston blasts
item.description: More proof that Joe Andruzzi is a great guy.

item.title: CIA wanted Boston suspect on terror watch list
item.description: U.S. officials who traveled to to the Russian Republic of Dagestan have interviewed at length the mother of the Boston bombing suspects in an attempt to determine how her two sons were radicalized.

item.title: FBI probes Ashley Judd tape at McConnell's request
item.description: Senate GOP leader Mitch McConnell's campaign asked the FBI to investigate a tape leaked to Mother Jones magazine in which his aides discussed attacking Ashley Judd's mental health and policy views.

item.title: Bubba Watson's hovercraft golf cart is real and it's spectacular
item.description: Check out the coolest golf cart you will ever see.

item.title: 'Cinnamon Challenge' fad could result in lung damage
item.description: A stunt in which participants willingly swallow a heaping, dry spoonful of the aromatic spice cinnamon in 60 seconds with no water went viral in 2012, becoming a social media sensation that resulted in more

item.title: Video shows Rutgers coach Mike Rice abusing players
item.description: Video footage showed coach Mike Rice hurling basketballs from close range at his players.

item.title: 1 hospitalized after Chicago sinkhole swallows 3 cars
item.description: A sinkhole swallowed three cars on the southeast side of Chicago on Thursday, injuring one person.

item.title: Awful April: Spring hard to find across northern USA
item.description: April has been a freakishly cold month across much of the northern USA, with temperatures that are more typical of winter than spring.

item.title: Atlanta educators face hefty bail over cheating scandal
item.description: Educators accused in a massive cheating scandal at the city's public schools began turning themselves in at Fulton County Jail on Tuesday, with some lawyers complaining about the high bonds their clients face.

item.title: Broadcaster Al Michaels arrested, charged with DUI in California
item.description: Do you believe in designated drivers?!

item.title: Louisville's Kevin Ware is moving around on crutches
item.description: The sophomore guard, who broke his leg Sunday, took several steps around his hospital room.

item.title: Carnival ship fails health inspection
item.description: Citing live flies, dried food waste and a

item.title: 2nd teen hiker rescued in California canyon
item.description: A second teenage hiker missing since Sunday was rescued Thursday in a rugged canyon near Los Angeles.

item.description: Every pick from the second round of the 2013 NFL draft.

item.title: Autopsy shows 'Buckwild' star Shain Gandee's death was accidental
item.description: Autopsy shows 'Buckwild' star Shain Gandee's died of carbon monoxide poisioning outside Charleston, W. Va.

item.title: Size indeed matters, suggests male attractiveness study
item.description: So much for that nice smile and neat haircut, women are indeed looking for a well-endowed guy, suggests am Australian study of male attractiveness

item.title: 'Teen Mom' star Farrah Abraham sells sex tape
item.description: Farrah Abraham closes deal for adult video with Vivid Entertainment.

item.title: Domestic dispute led to Wash. shootings that killed 5
item.description: There was no immediate word what set off the gunfire in an apartment complex south of Seattle that has led to the death of 5 people, including a suspect.

item.title: Lawyer: Widow of alleged Boston bomber suspected nothing
item.description: The young widow of Boston Marathon bombing suspect Tamerlan Tsarnaev learned of his alleged role in the attacks the same way millions of Americans did: She saw it on TV.

item.title: Boston amputee to fiancée: 'I am sorry for being there'
item.description: Jen Regan of Stoneham, Mass. spoke publicly for the first time Monday about the challenges facing her fiancé, Marc Fucarile, severely injured in the Boston Marathon bombings.

item.title: Lindsey Vonn is watching boyfriend Tiger Woods at the Masters
item.description: Tiger's girlfriend is there supporting his run in the Masters.

item.title: For Reese Witherspoon, arrest is a 'PR nightmare'
item.description: There's the art of persuasion, and then there's the power of perception. In Hollywood, perception is guarded carefully by publicists, employed by studios and stars to keep projects hot and celebs in the

item.title: Kevin Ware never wants to 'watch replay' of gruesome injury
item.description: Kevin Ware

item.title: Boat owner shaken after finding bombing suspect
item.description: The man who found the Boston bombing suspect in his boat Friday night may be a hero, but he's an angry hero if the boat got shot up in the gunfire that preceded the fugitive's capture, a neighbor said.

item.title: Overwhelming kindness follows Boston Marathon blast
item.description: Some acts of decency grew out of a terrible event.

item.title: Beauty Katherine Webb quits 'Splash' because of injury
item.description: Beauty queen Katherine Webb had to bow out of the diving show.

item.title: Va. mall gunman announced shooting online minutes before
item.description: An 18-year-old community college student was charged with wounding two women with a shotgun at a mall branch of the school in southwestern Virginia Friday afternoon.

item.title: Man shoots himself in the head during NRA 500 at Texas
item.description: A medical examiner says a man who died in the infield during the NRA 500 at Texas Motor Speedway shot himself in the head.

item.title: Zack Greinke breaks collarbone in bench-clearing brawl
item.description: Zack Greinke fractured his left collarbone in a bench-clearing brawl during the Dodgers' victory over the Padres, prompting enraged Matt Kemp to confront Carlos Quentin in the clubhouse tunnel after the game .

item.title: Third Marathon death: Boston U. grad student from China
item.description: A day after tragedy struck the Boston Marathon, the city begins to move forward.

item.title: After Boston blasts, Obama vows to get answers
item.description: Warns Americans not to jump to conclusions about who is responsible.

item.title: Dad of 8-year-old mourns: 'My dear son Martin has died'
item.description: Family was cheering friends on in marathon when bomb exploded

item.description: The film critic fought salivary gland and thyroid cancer for a decade.

item.description: Which singers are in danger of going home? And what's the twist Ryan Seacrest promised?

item.title: Bodies recovered of 2 kids buried at N.C. work site
item.description: Emergency crews early Monday found the bodies of two young children who were buried by a wall of dirt at a home construction site in rural North Carolina.

item.description: Every pick from the third round of the 2013 NFL draft.

item.title: Disfigured veteran deals with disrespect at home
item.description: Tony Porta, disfigured in Iraq, has sustained additional wounds at home.

item.title: Boston bombing suspects' mom in terror database
item.description: About 18 months before the Boston bombings, the CIA added the mother of the two suspects to a terrorism database after Russian authorities raised concerns she and her oldest son were religious militants.

item.title: Holmes' doctor warned police before Colo. theater attack
item.description: A University of Colorado psychiatrist told campus police a month before the Aurora movie theater attack that James Holmes had homicidal thoughts and was a public danger, according to records unsealed Thursday.

item.title: Obama seeks reprise of Speaker Pelosi
item.description: President Obama wants to work with congressional Republicans and all that, but he is also making it clear he wants Democrats to re-take control of the U.S. House and re-install Speaker Pelosi

item.description: Rutgers University has fired coach Mike Rice less than 24 hours after revealing video footage.

item.description: You probably can't tell from Nicki Minaj's steamy new music video,

item.title: M*A*S*H star Allan Arbus dies at 95
item.description: Allan Arbus, known to many of us at the psychiatrist Maj. Sidney Freedman from M*A*S*H, has died at age 95.

item.title: USA TODAY founder Al Neuharth dies at 89
item.description: Allen H. Neuharth, the newspaper visionary and former Gannett chairman who founded USA TODAY, helped create a museum dedicated to news and became one of the industry's most influential and sometimes

item.title: American student gang raped in Brazil
item.description: An American woman was gang raped and beaten aboard a public transport van while her French boyfriend was shackled, hit with a crowbar and forced to watch the attacks after the pair boarded the vehicle in Rio de Janeiro's showcase Copacabana beach neighborhood, police said.

item.title: 8-year-old family dog kills Georgia toddler
item.description: UNION CITY, Ga. — A family dog who had never shown aggression before attacked and killed a 2-year-old boy Wednesday in a subdivision about 15 miles south of Atlanta, police said. The mother, Angela Rutledge,

item.title: Kate Upton dating Diddy?
item.description: Diddyup, everyone.

item.title: Man in cowboy hat in Boston photo faced many tragedies
item.description: Carlos Arredondo was waiting at the Boston Marathon finish line for runners who were racing on behalf of fallen soldiers -- one of those fallen soldiers being Arredondo's son -- and handing out American flags

item.title: No TV? 5 million U.S. households bid boob tube goodbye
item.description: Some people have had it with TV. They've had enough of the 100-plus channel universe. They don't like timing their lives around network show schedules. They're tired of $100-plus monthly bills.

item.title: Study: Synchronized sounds sharpen sleep
item.description: Looking for better sleep? Lose the white-noise machine and listen for something a little more tuned to your brain's own rhythms, suggests a Thursday study performed by neuroscientists.

item.title: Pat Summerall, called a 'broadcasting giant,' has died
item.description: For many sports fans in the 1960s through the 1990s, Pat Summerall was the voice of the NFL, starting with CBS' Sunday telecasts and later with Fox, famously paired for much of that time with John Madden.

item.title: Easter Egg Roll: Celebs, tots romp on White House lawn
item.description: The Easter Bunny, dozens of professional athletes and thousands of children were hippity-hopping across the White House's South Lawn Monday for the annual egg roll.

item.title: Man slices arms with saws at Calif. Home Depot
item.description: Unidentified man grabbed hand saws and cut his arms to the bone inside a Home Depot store.

item.title: Gold selloff intensifies, price plunges 9.35%
item.description: Gold is being mauled by the bear again in early trading Monday, knocking the yellow metal down more than 7% and below the key $1,400 per-ounce level. Gold is now down more than 26% from its Aug. 2011 peak.

item.title: Kevin Ware on Louisville teammate that 'touched my heart'
item.description: Luke Hancock was the first person to reach Louisville's Kevin Ware after his broken leg against Duke. The teammate offered support and a prayer that touched Ware's heart.

item.title: Digging into the past of NCAA President Mark Emmert
item.description: A look at how NCAA President Mark Emmert handled scandals at previous jobs at UConn and LSU. Criticism has swirled over how the NCAA has handled the cases of Penn State and Miami under his leadership.

item.title: Officer accused of having Trayvon Martin targets
item.description: Sgt. Ron King was leading a target practice with two other officers and a civilian when he pulled out the Trayvon Martin targets on April 4, officials said.

item.title: Winds scrub lift of World Trade Center spire
item.description: When the last pieces of its spire rise to the roof of the One World Trade Center, the skyscraper that replaces the fallen twin towers will be just feet from becoming the highest in the Western Hemisphere.

item.description: Blasts at a Texas fertilizer plant leveled buildings for blocks in every direction.

item.description: The Chechen brothers at the heart of the Boston Marathon bombing investigation lived regular American lives - until something changed them.

item.title: Trayvon Martin's parents settle with Fla. HOA
item.description: SANFORD, Fla. (AP) — The parents of a teenager who was fatally shot by a neighborhood watch volunteer last year have settled a wrongful-death claim against the homeowners association of the Florida subdivision where their son was killed.

item.description: Another guy goes home. But that wasn't the big surprise.

item.description: President Obama has apologized to California Attorney General Kamala Harris for commenting Thursday on her looks, an aide said Friday.

item.title: China quake leaves nearly 200 dead, 6,700 injured
item.description: A powerful earthquake struck the steep hills of China's southwestern Sichuan province on Saturday, leaving at least 156 people dead and more than 5,500 injured.

item.description: Twitter, Google and YouTube are having some fun this April Fools' Day.

item.title: Jon Jones stops Chael Sonnen in first round at UFC 159

item.description: A man who intentionally sawed his arms to the bone in a Home Depot store in California remained hospitalized in critical condition on Thursday while investigators tried to determine what led to the horrific action.

item.title: Jodi Arias trial nearing its conclusion, judge says
item.description: PHOENIX -- The end is near. Maricopa County Superior Court Judge Sherry Stephens told the Jodi Arias jury that the guilt-and-innocence phase of the four-month-long murder trial will end a week from Friday.

item.description: Rutgers, of all universities, should have known better. Rutgers should have known that a coach who fires basketballs at the heads of his players and assaults them at practice should not keep his job. The so-called leaders of Rutgers University should have known that if a coach is hurling homophobic and misogynistic insults at his male players, he shouldn't be allowed to represent the school for one more hour, much less four more months.

item.title: Adam Scott wins Masters, the first for Australia
item.description: AUGUSTA, Ga. — Carrying the weight of an entire continent on his back and hauling around the burden of expectation for years hasn't been easy at times for Adam Scott of Australia.

item.description: Report alleges Auburn's program paid players, altered grades and violated recruiting rules.

item.title: Hostess reopens bakeries for Twinkies, Ho Hos
item.description: The new Hostess Brands said Monday that it will open bakeries in Indiana and Illinois, following announcements last week that it will reopen bakeries in Georgia and Kansas in its effort to bring back some of its snack brands.

item.title: Double up: Diet, exercise together are key to success
item.description: People who tackle diet and exercise at the same time do better at making healthy changes, according to a new study.

item.title: 'Family Guy' creator condemns bomb-clip mashup
item.description: Family Guy creator Seth MacFarlane is speaking out against an edited mash-up of show clips that suggest a prediction of Monday's Boston Marathon bombing.

item.title: George Jones' funeral will be open to the public
item.description: The funeral for country singer George Jones, who died Friday morning at age 81, will take place Thursday at the Grand Ole Opry House in Nashville, and will be open to the public.

item.title: Snow, other wild wintry weather springs up
item.description: A ferocious storm is dumping heavy snow across portions of the Rockies and northern Plains Tuesday. Winter storm warnings are in effect from New Mexico to Wisconsin.

item.title: Bribery probe snares NYC Democrat seeking mayor's seat
item.description: A New York state lawmaker was arrested along with several other politicians in an alleged plot to bribe his way into the race for mayor of New York City.

item.description: California's mighty redwoods are going international, cloned in an effort to promote reforestation and deal with climate change.
